text: The Chief Justice of Canada () is the presiding judge of the nine-member Supreme Court of Canada, the highest judicial body in Canada. ==List of chief justices== Since the Supreme Court was established in 1875, the following 18 persons have served as Chief Justice: Name (Province) Order and term Order and term Length of term Appointed on advice of Date of birth Date of death (Ontario) September 30, 1875 – January 10, 1879 Mackenzie (New Brunswick) January 11, 1879 – September 25, 1892 Macdonald (Ontario) December 13, 1892 – November 17, 1902 Thompson (Quebec) November 21, 1902 – May 1, 1906 Laurier (Quebec) June 4, 1906 – October 20, 1918 Laurier (Prince Edward Island) October 23, 1918 – May 1, 1924 Borden (Ontario) February 27, 1933 King (British Columbia) March 17, 1933 – January 6, 1944 Bennett (Quebec) January 8, 1944 – June 21, 1954 King (Ontario) July 1, 1954 – February 2, 1963 St. Laurent (Quebec) April 22, 1963 – Pearson (Ontario) September 1, 1967 – March 22, 1970 Pearson (Quebec) March 23, 1970 – December 22, 1973 P. Trudeau (Ontario) December 27, 1973 – March 26, 1984 P. Trudeau (Manitoba) April 18, 1984 – June 29, 1990 P. Trudeau (Quebec) July 1, 1990 – January 6, 2000 Mulroney (British Columbia) January 7, 2000 – December 14, 2017 Chrétien \--(living) (Quebec) December 18, 2017 – Incumbent J. Trudeau \--(living) ==Notes== ==References==
title: Chief Justice of Canada
